author: Special Correspondent
text:
An Associate Professor of Thiru. Vi. Ka. Government Arts College, Tiruvarur, was attacked by three motorcycle-borne persons in Tiruvarur town on Thursday.

The incident took place when P. Sivaraman, a faculty member of Commerce belonging to Scheduled Caste, was on his way from his residence. Police sources said the three assaulted Mr. Sivaraman with a wooden log, injuring him on the head.

After carrying out the attack, the assailants fled the spot. The motorcycle used by the attackers has been seized as the vehicle apparently skidded a few km away from the place of attack.

The professor was admitted to the Tiruvarur Medical College Hospital as in-patient. The Tiruvarur Town police are investigating, the sources said.

Meanwhile, the Government College Teachers Manram has condemned the “barbaric” assault on the Professor.

In a joint statement, Manram’s president Dr. Loganathan and joint secretary V. Sivaraman urged the State government to take severe action against those responsible for the attack on Dr. Sivaraman. It said such brutal attacks on teachers should immediately be prevented by the government. Otherwise, the teachers would not be able to discharge their duty.
title: Dalit college professor assaulted
